current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to provide protections for active duty military consumers,
			 and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text: Notice of status as an active duty military consumer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by adding at the end the following:

text.#text:
With respect to an adverse item of information about a consumer, if the action or inaction that
			 gave rise to the item occurred while the consumer was an active duty
			 military consumer, the consumer may provide appropriate proof, including
			 official orders, to a consumer reporting agency that the consumer was an
			 active duty military consumer at the time such action or inaction
			 occurred, and any consumer report provided by the consumer reporting
			 agency that includes the item shall clearly and conspicuously disclose
			 that the consumer was an active duty military consumer when the action or
			 inaction that gave rise to the item occurred.

header.#text: Notice of status as an active duty military consumer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, respectively, and
			 moving such redesignated subparagraphs 2 ems to the right;

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

If a consumer reporting agency receives an adverse item of information about a consumer who has
			 provided appropriate proof that the consumer is an active duty military
			 consumer, the consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the
			 consumer—

that the consumer reporting agency has received the adverse item of information, along with a
			 description of the item; and
the method by which the consumer may dispute the validity of the item.

If a consumer who has provided appropriate proof to a consumer reporting agency that the consumer
			 is an active duty military consumer provides the consumer reporting agency
			 with contact information for the purpose of communicating with the 
			 consumer while the consumer is an active military consumer, the consumer
			 reporting agency shall use such contact information for all communications
			 while the consumer is an active military consumer.

header.#text: Contact information for active duty military consumers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that any person making use of a consumer report that contains  an
			 adverse item of  information should, if the action or inaction that gave
			 rise to the item occurred while the consumer was an active duty military
			 consumer, take such fact into account when evaluating the creditworthiness
			 of the consumer.
, by adding at the end the following:

text.#text: include such fact in the file of the consumer; and
indicate such fact in each consumer report that includes the disputed item.

header.#text: Notice of dispute related to active duty military consumers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is under dispute, if
			 the consumer to whom the item relates has notified the consumer reporting
			 agency, and has provided appropriate proof, that the consumer was an
			 active duty military consumer at the time the action or inaction that gave
			 rise to the disputed item occurred, the consumer reporting agency shall—

text.#text: With respect to an item of information described under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2456 IS: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to provide protections for active duty military consumers, and for other purposes.
